<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Unfettered Halfling](/Feats.aspx?ID=58) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Halfling" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=87" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 52 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You were forced into service as a laborer, either pressed into indentured servitude or shackled by the evils of slavery, but you've since escaped and have trained to ensure you'll never be caught again. Whenever you roll a success on a check to [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) or a saving throw against an effect that would impose the [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33) condition on you, you get a critical success instead. Whenever a creature rolls a failure on a check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) you, they get a critical failure instead. If a creature uses the [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) ability on you, it must succeed at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to grab you instead of automatically grabbing you.
name: Unfettered Halfling
